trans-unit.source: Represents a collection of child controls in a table layout container.
The TableLayoutControlCollection class represents the collection of all the child controls in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TableLayoutPanel> control.
This collection is exposed by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TableLayoutPanel.Controls%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TableLayoutPanel> class.
You can manage and individually manipulate members of the table layout panel through the TableLayoutControlCollection exposed by <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TableLayoutPanel.Controls%2A>.
The TableLayoutControlCollection class is a minor specialization of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection> base class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TableLayoutControlCollection"></xref> class.
Generally, the application programmer will not directly create instances of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TableLayoutControlCollection> class.
Instead, a reference to an existing <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TableLayoutControlCollection> is returned by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TableLayoutPanel.Controls%2A> property.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TableLayoutPanel"></xref> control that contains the control collection.
Adds the specified control to the collection and positions it at the specified cell.
With Add, you can specify the cell position of `control`.

You can assign `control` to a specific cell by providing both the `column` and `row` parameters, or you can specify only the column or row value and let the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TableLayoutPanel.LayoutEngine%2A> place `control` at the next open cell.
This is known as letting the control *flow* to its position in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TableLayoutPanel> control.
Set `column` to -1 if you want `control` to occupy a fixed row position.
Set `row` to -1 if you want `control` to occupy a fixed column position.
If neither `column` nor `row` is -1, `control` will be added at the absolute position given by (`column`, `row`).

If you set both `column` and `row` to -1, `control` will flow to the first open position, with the specific flow behavior defined by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TableLayoutPanel.GrowStyle%2A?displayProperty=fullName> value.
This is equivalent to using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.Add%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
To get to the actual current position of a control, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TableLayoutPanel.GetPositionFromControl%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.

This method takes into account the entire <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TableLayoutPanel> control state, including column or row spanning and when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TableLayoutPanel.LayoutEngine%2A?displayProperty=fullName> has placed a control with its `Column` and `Row` properties set to -1.
The control to add.
The column in which `control` will be placed.
The row in which `control` will be placed.
Either column or row is less than -1.
Gets the parent <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TableLayoutPanel"></xref> that contains the controls in the collection.
This property is set by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TableLayoutControlCollection.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TableLayoutPanel"></xref> that contains the controls in the current collection.
